page.title: 13BRADFIELD-CLAY HILL
page.content: Clay Hill is largely farmland, woods and scattered housing. The people are mostly retired or self employed. The member of Parliament for Newbury and district Mr McNair Wilson lives at Nine Elms Farm. There is a small timber yard with wood working machinery.All the local road sign posts are made here. A furniture repairer occupies a farm building. Another cottage industry is chair caning and repairing. Much of the woodland used to be hunting woods for royalty. In the woods is the site of a roman camp. There are two small holding farms. The rest of the land is used for wheat and barley. Fields are still bordered by hedges.
